extraMetadata.title: Usage Behavior
extraMetadata.description: Usage Behavior is a weekly report describing ways in which desktop users are interacting with the web.

locale.title: Top Languages
description: Top Languages shows the distribution of the top 5 language settings for Firefox Desktop.
Worldwide, en-US remains the most common, about 40% of the population, with German (11%) and French (6.5%) coming 2^nd^ and 3^rd^. Russian and es-ES bring up 4^th^ and 5^th^ with around 5% each.
For most countries in the top 10, the majority (>90%) of users have their language set to the local language, with a notable exception in Indonesia, which has about 80% en-US and 20% Indonesian.

pct_TP.title: Always On Tracking Protection
description: Always On Tracking Protection shows the percentage of Firefox Desktop clients with Tracking Protection enabled for all browsing sessions.

Tracking Protection is a feature which blocks sites from tracking users across multiple websites, adding a layer of privacy to browsing. This feature is on by default in Private Browsing sessions, but starting in FF57, we gave users the option to [enable this feature for all browsing sessions](https://support.mozilla.org/kb/tracking-protection).
Note: This is only the percentage of users with Always On Tracking Protection and does not include Tracking Protection use in Private Browsing.

pct_addon.title: Has Add-on
description: Has Add-on shows the percentage of Firefox Desktop clients with user installed add-ons.

One of the best things about Firefox is the robust add-on community which gives users the option to customize and control their browsing experience. Our users agree, with over a third of Firefox users having at least 1 installed add-on.
Globally, this metric varies, with China and Brazil showing only about 20% and 18% of users with add-ons, respectively, while Russia is on the other extreme, having almost 60% of users with add-ons.

top10addons.title: Top Add-ons
description: Top Add-ons shows the top 10 most popular Firefox Desktop add-ons for a week.

Overall, the most popular add-ons are ad-blockers, coming in first in almost all of the top 10 countries. Ad-blocking seems particularly popular in Germany and France, with 4 of the top 10 add-ons being ad-blockers in France.
